pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:0.5: 59. The training rule on holding a knife
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people holding a knife. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.3: “‘I will not give teachings to anyone holding a knife who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.5: a weapon with a one-edged or two-edged blade.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.6: One should not give teachings to anyone holding a knife who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.7: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings to someone holding a knife who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.9: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.10: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk59:1.11: The ninth training rule is finished.
